activities: Personal information is received, used, disclosed and otherwise processed by VIDA in accordance with the Safe Harbor Principles to facilitate complaint handling/ adverse event reporting, clinical trial research, core lab services, internal record keeping, requests for additional information and other legal and business activities. Personal information is collected, whether directly or indirectly, from patients, customers, healthcare providers, clinical trial partners, Business Partners and website users. When the personal information collected is patient information, VIDA requests that the data set be de-identified prior to its transfer from the EU/EEA or Switzerland. In rare instances where the data arrives in identifiable form, VIDA de-identifies the data in-house. This description applies to personal data VIDA obtains from individuals in the EU/EEA and Switzerland.
contacttitle1: Director, Business Operations and Quality Management
corpofftitle1: Director, Business Operations and Quality Management
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: clinical trial data, customer, business partner, patient, health care provider, website user
